title: Trends and Challenges Towards an Effective Data-Driven Decision Making in UK SMEs: Case Studies and Lessons Learnt from the Analysis of 85 SMEs. (arXiv:2305.15454v1 [cs.CY])
abstract: The adoption of data science brings vast benefits to Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) including business productivity, economic growth, innovation and jobs creation. Data Science can support SMEs to optimise production processes, anticipate customers' needs, predict machinery failures and deliver efficient smart services. Businesses can also harness the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Big Data and the smart use of digital technologies to enhance productivity and performance, paving the way for innovation. However, integrating data science decisions into an SME requires both skills and IT investments. In most cases, such expenses are beyond the means of SMEs due to limited resources and restricted access to financing. This paper presents trends and challenges towards an effective data-driven decision making for organisations based on a case study of 85 SMEs, mostly from the West Midlands region of England. translated_title: 英国中小企业有效数据驱动决策的趋势与挑战：基于对85家中小企业案例研究和经验教训分析
translated_abstract: 数据科学的采用为中小型企业带来了巨大的好处，包括提高业务生产力、促进经济增长、创新和创造就业机会。数据科学可以支持中小企业优化生产流程，预测客户需求，预测机器故障并提供高效的智能服务。企业还可以利用人工智能和大数据的力量以及智能使用数字技术来提高生产力和业务表现，为创新铺平道路。然而，将数据科学决策整合到中小企业中需要技能和IT投资。在大多数情况下，由于资源有限和融资渠道受限，这些费用超出了中小企业的负担范围。本文以英国西米德兰地区为主要案例研究85家中小企业，提出了针对组织有效数据驱动决策的趋势和挑战。该工作是作为3年ERDF（欧洲区域发展基金）计划的一部分资助的。
tldr: 本文以英国西米德兰地区85家中小企业为例，探讨了中小企业在进行有效数据驱动决策方面面临的趋势和挑战，尤其是由于有限的资源和融资渠道受限等原因，如何在技能和IT投资方面寻找平衡。
en_tdlr: This paper presents trends and challenges towards effective data-driven decision making for SMEs based on a case study of 85 SMEs in the West Midlands region of England, highlighting the balance that must be found between skills and IT investments, particularly given the limited resources and restricted access to financing.
